creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: book with black and white outline prints of birds on trees; flower blossoms; rooster on a rock; waterfowl; a crow; fish; insects, etc.; dark olive green cover
markings: URC on cover page, in pencil: [# 12 vol. 1]
medium: Woodblock printed book; ink and color on paper
text: In Japan, the picture books wasere a genre in and of itself. Unlike Western picture books, often associated with children, Japanese publishers and illustrators treated the book as a site for recordkeeping, experimentation, and inspirations. The books served those who had broad interests in art, from wanting to paint to simply wanting to see various motifs and subjects in visual form.
title: Sō Shiseki Picture Album (Sō Shiseki gafu), vol. 1
